item.title: PPoGA: Predictive Plan-on-Graph with Action for Knowledge Graph Question Answering
item.description: arXiv:2602.00007v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) augmented with Knowledge Graphs (KGs) have advanced complex question answering, yet they often remain susceptible to failure when their initial high-level reasoning plan is flawed. item.title: DIVERGE: Diversity-Enhanced RAG for Open-Ended Information Seeking
item.description: arXiv:2602.00238v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Existing retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) systems are primarily designed under the assumption that each query has a single correct answer. item.title: KAG - KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.
item.description: KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> GitHub | <strong>Keywords:</strong> vector, knowledge base, RAG, retrieval, LLM | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (GitHub)
